file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 32-44-07-05 - PRESSURE SWITCH (EMERGENCY/PARKING BRAKE) - ADJUSTMENT/TEST

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL PRESSURE SWITCH (EMERGENCY/PARKING BRAKE) - ADJUSTMENT/TEST EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to do a check of the operation of the pressure switch of the Emergency/Parking Brake. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY PRESSURE SWITCH OF THE EMERGEN- ALL 32-44-07-700-801-A CY/PARKING BRAKE - OPERATIONAL CHECK EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 32-44-07 Page 1 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 32-44-07-700-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. PRESSURE SWITCH OF THE EMERGENCY/PARKING BRAKE - OPERATIONAL CHECK A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to do a check of the operation of the pressure switch of the Emergency/Parking Brake. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM SDS 23-40-00/1 ENERGIZATION OF THE AIRCRAFT WITH AN EX- AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200 TERNAL POWER SOURCE HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - PRESSURIZATION WITH AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-801-A/200 HTS AMM TASK 32-00-01-910-801-A/200 LG SAFETY PIN - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 113 113EL Forward Fuselage D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY GSE 044 Headset, ramp handling For communications GSE 012 Wheel chock To put at the aircraft wheel E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit 1 Helps the other technician Outside the aircraft EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 32-44-07 Page 2 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Make sure that the safety pins of the landing gears are installed ( AMM TASK 32-00-01-910-801-A/200). (2) Put chocks at the landing gear wheels. (3) Open access door 113EL (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (4) Energize the aircraft with the External DC Power Supply ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). (5) Pressurize hydraulic system 2 only ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-801-A/200). (6) Connect the ramp interphone (AMM SDS 23-40-00/1). (7) Make sure that the thrust levers are in the flight IDLE position. J. Operational Check of the Pressure Switch of the Emergency/Parking Brake (Figure 501) SUBTASK 710-002-A (1) Do the check of the pressure switch of the Emergency/Parking Brake as follows: NOTE: To prevent hydraulic fluid transference from system 1 to system 2 or vice versa, first apply brakes with the pedals and then pull or release the emergency/parking brake handle. (a) Set the thrust levers to the THRUST SET position. (b) Release the parking Brake handle to the rest position. Result: 1 On the Instrument and Ramp panels, the BRAKE ON lights go off. (c) Pull the Emergency/Parking Brake fully until you lock it. Result: 1 On the Instrument and Ramp panels, the BRAKE ON lights come on. (d) Set the thrust levers to the flight IDLE position. Result: 1 On the Instrument and Ramp panels, the BRAKE ON lights stay on. (e) Set the thrust levers to the THRUST SET position. Result: 1 On the EICAS display, the NO TAKE-OFF CONFIG warning message comes on. 2 The “Take-Off Brakes” aural warning is activated. (f) Release the parking brake handle to the rest position. Result: 1 On the EICAS display, the NO TAKE-OFF CONFIG warning message stays on. 2 The “Take-Off Brakes” aural warning is cancelled. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 32-44-07 Page 3 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Set the thrust levers to the flight IDLE position. (2) Pull the Emergency/Parking Brake fully until you lock it. NOTE: To prevent hydraulic fluid transference from system 1 to system 2 or vice versa, first apply brakes with the pedals and then pull or release the emergency/parking brake handle. (3) Release the pressure from the hydraulic system ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-801-A/ 200). (4) Deenergize the aircraft ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 32-44-07 Page 4 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
